jobDescription: As a Scientist in Research and Technology Development at Illumina you will work in a dynamic, team-oriented environment and play a key role in creating the next generation of genomic tools. The position involves supporting the development of novel sequencing technologies through innovations in platform and sample preparation. You will be a key contributor to multidisciplinary teams developing and improving leading-edge technology platforms. A highly motivated and enthusiastic scientist with broad experience in instrumentation, molecular biology, and surface chemistry will be an ideal fit for this position.  Tasks and Responsibilities:  Design, develop and troubleshoot assays, chemistry and methods for monitoring interactions between molecules/biomolecules and polymeric materials  Develop and implement tools, metrologies and test methods for the characterization of microparticles, polymers, hydrogels and other materials  Gather, organize and analyze large data sets  Troubleshoot and improve existing processes, tools and chemistries to create robust products and improve process performance  Work independently and within multi-disciplinarily project teams of scientists, engineers, programmers, and project coordinators  Engage in clear and concise communication with colleagues and supervisors through oral updates, written reports and technical meetings.  All listed tasks and responsibilities are deemed as essential functions to this position. However, business conditions may require reasonable accommodations for additional tasks and responsibilities  Required Skills & Experience  Ph.D. in Chemistry, Materials or Polymer Science, Biomedical Engineering, Physics or other related discipline  Extensive hands-on experience in one or more of the following disciplines: polymer chemistry, surface-mediated biochemistry, microfluidic assays, advanced materials  Proven track record of creativity and innovation combined with the ability to complete complex tasks with minimum supervision  Experience with DNA sequencing, biochemical assays and molecular biology techniques.  Experience in bio-conjugation and functionalization of advanced materials with molecules and biomolecules to modulate biomolecular reactions  Hands-on experience in multiple techniques and methods for characterization of materials, surfaces, reactions and biomolecules  Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment, setting and achieving goals independently  Motivated, enthusiastic, hard-working, cheerful individual who wants to be part of a fast-paced and dynamic technology development Team  Preferred Skills & Experience  Broad scientific knowledge on the fundamentals of materials science such as chemistry, physics, instrumentation set-ups, optics, thermodynamics, kinetics, spectroscopy.  Bioinformatics, programming (Matlab, Python, Perl, R), and data analysis skills (such as DOE or other advanced statistical tools)  Experience setting up and programming custom instrumentation  Solid understanding of DNA and RNA enzymology including polymerases, nucleases, modification enzymes, etc. Experience developing and optimizing enzymatic processes.
